subject: Horses
lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old woman died yesterday after her horse stumbled during a cross-country jumping event and crushed her. Eleanor Brennan, of Esmont, Va., was competing in the 2007 Horse Trials in Ocala, Fla., and was riding an 11-year-old male named Mister Barnabus. The horse struck a gate during the event, tumbled onto his neck and landed on Brennan, a statement from the Marion County Sheriff’s Office said.
